196.text:

212.text:

The senate meetings would involve speeches,

271.text:

279.text:
Oratorical skills did not come automatically

286.text:

293.text:

298.text:

306.text:

311.text:

321.text:

331.text:
Starting off with defending client in civil

337.text:

making himself a name as a brilliant orator

344.text:

367.text:

376.text:

384.text:

390.text:

397.text:

417.text:

421.text: elite and, not least, to Pompeius himself.

Cicero’s speech on behalf of Pompey is famous
for being his first speech in the contio,

435.text:

442.text:

450.text:

467.text:

473.text:

493.text:

508.text:
His presence – as a source as well as a
protagonist – is both a bonus and a problem.

515.text:

dominates the field to such an extent that

520.text:

527.text:

534.text:

541.text:

549.text:

556.text:

561.text: have only a couple from the imperial period.

However, what we don’t have in full, we

572.text:

580.text:

set about collecting this evidence and the

587.text:

for the past 80 years or so: Enrica Malcovati’s

594.text:
Oratorum Romanorum Fragmenta, first edition
1930 and the fourth edition 1976. The Latin

603.text:

of the Roman Orators – betrays its audience,

612.text:

scholars working on Roman oratory, rhetoric

619.text:

fragments and testimonies of Roman republican

627.text:

notes in Latin. No translation or commentary

635.text:

have seemed necessary at the time of the first

641.text:

historian Ernst Badian, wrote in the Journal

646.text:

who more deserve the thanks of the readers

652.text:

whose care and acumen have salvaged far more

658.text:

Badian was absolutely right because the work

665.text:

Cicero’s speeches into the context of other

675.text:

683.text:

689.text:

702.text:

708.text:

722.text:

729.text:
